intro: Silene suaveolens, commonly known as sweet william, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Silene suaveolens is also known for its fragrant blooms and is often used in floral arrangements.
